intro: Poterium microphylum, commonly known as the small-leafed poterium, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Poterium microphylum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate structure and subtle appearance make it a unique addition to botanical collections.
